results.title: The Happy pace of Switzerland
results.creator_credit: Swiss National Tourist Office, Condor Films and Nicolas Gessner
results.brief_description: A story without words set to Rossini’s “String Sonata in C Major” performed by the Zurich Chamber Orchestra led by Edmond de Stoutz, involves a modern day fantasy about a truck driver’s encounter with an elegant, riderless, horse drawn coach. The parallel paths of truck and coach on the opposite shores of a lovely Swiss lake merge in a climax when the driver abandons his truck and joyfully takes up the reins behind the trotting white horse.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swiss National Tourist Office, Condor Films and Nicolas Gessner

results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SOUND]
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, W H Productions, Mack Sennett Comedies and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: A burlesque of the famous poem by Hugh Antoine D’Arcy of the broken-down artist who, having lost his wife to another man, draws her face on the floor and then passes out, drunk. Sound version with piano accompaniament.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company, Mack Sennett Comedies and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: The plot is a satire derived from Hugh Antoine D’Arcy’s poem “The Face on the bar room floor. It tells of the broken-down artist (Charlie Chaplin) who, having lost his wife (Cecile Arnold) to another man, draws her face on the floor of a bar room. Charlie tells his tragic story in flashbacks. NB: Silent film with no soundtrack.
results.title_for_label: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]

results.title: The Hague - Holland
results.creator_credit: Hans Vos, Carrilon Films, Holland and Caspar Willers
results.brief_description: The capital of the Netherlands is a felicitous mixture of the old and the new. The film explores the city and the cultural and international events that take place there.

results.title: The Gypsy moth
results.brief_description: The uncontrolled spread of the gypsy moth is creating a serious problem that is difficult to estimate economically. In this film the audience sees the type and extent of the damage caused by these prolific insects, as well as the ease with which they are transported from one area to another by unsuspecting humans. The moth was introduced to North America from Europe in 7869 by a scientist, and has now spread with insufficient naturel predators, thereby causing great damage to Canada’s forests and crops. Superb photography.

results.title: The Guide to 35mm photography
results.brief_description: Brian Ratty introduces this instructional video on how to use a 35mm camera. The program is divided into three half-hour chapters. Part one covers: How the SLR works, “f” stops and shutter speeds, exposure, depth of field and film. Part two covers: Lenses, available light, flash, filters and steady shooting. Part three covers: seeing with the camera, candids, portraits, the environmental portrait and sports and action.
